result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth M Maclin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The Court sentences Mr. Maclin to 15 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 months.  This sentence is consecutive to any sentence in being.
Consecutive to: any sentence in being.

superMiscConds.notes: --to pay costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

--to pay restitution of $1,243 to Walmart Restitution Recovery [Payment reference numbers: RE10074934414 and RE10074934315;  Restitution payment address:  Walmart Restitution Recovery, PO Box 504765, St. Louis MO 63150-4765] joint and several with the Co-Defendant [Ronda M. Granja].

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".

The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth M Maclin

defendant.name: Maclin, Kenneth M
defendant.address: 1819 Aberg Ave, c/o Dane County Job Center, Madison, WI 53704

records.addlTxt: Stipulation for Sentencing Credit

[MK] case called at 4:11pm 
Defendant Kenneth M Maclin in court, in custody, with Attorney Peter Anderson.  ADA Brookellen Teuber in court for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance; victim restitution information is submitted.
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of " No Contest  " entered; factual basis stipulated including as to Repeater status;  the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Maclin to 15 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 12 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3 months.  This sentence is consecutive to any sentence in being. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Earned Release Program. 
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 0 days credit for time already served. The Court directs counsel to work together to reach a stipulation on any days credit due; this stipulation is to be filed within thirty days. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--to pay restitution of $1,243 to Walmart Restitution Recovery [Payment reference numbers: RE10074934414 and RE10074934315;  Restitution payment address:  Walmart Restitution Recovery, PO Box 504765, St. Louis MO 63150-4765] joint and several with the Co-Defendant [Ronda M. Granja].
--to pay costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings are given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form is given to the Defendant
recess 4:35pm
w/ elements and ccs
JA response to defendants 10/19/22 letter
certified copy to DA (10/20/22--ma)
to Produce

[MK] cases #22CF108 and #22CF109 called at 11:16am 
Co-Defendant Ronda M Granja appears by videoconferencing from the Dane County Jail, in custody. Attorney Richard Burris appears in court. 
Co-Defendant Kenneth M Maclin appears by videoconference from Oshkosh Correctional Institution, in custody. Attorney Peter Anderson appears in court.  
ADA Brookellen Teuber appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
The Courts that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.  

As to Case #22CF108-Granja: 
--Attorney Burris requests the scheduling of a plea hearing on a later date so that Ms. Granja can be transported to appear in person at the hearing. 

As to Case #22CF109-Maclin: 
--Attorney Anderson requests the scheduling of a plea and sentencing hearing
--Mr. Maclin indicates that he wishes to appear in person and have the hearing scheduled next week. However he then inquires if the hearing could be held with his appearance by video on the November 1st date discussed by the Court and counsel.  Thereafter Attorney Anderson indicates he will discuss appearance-format and notify the Court if there is a change in Mr. Maclin's request to appear in person and have the hearing next week.  
recess 11:28am 


NEXT:  (1) In case #22CF109 only- Plea & Sentencing on October 24th at 3:00pm--the State is to prepare a writ,  (2) In case #22CF108 only-Plea & Sentencing on November 1st at 2:30pm- the State is to prepare a writ
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Letter from defendant re case

Pre-trial conference on October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

[ma] Cases 22CF108 and 22CF109 called at 9:26 AM

Defendant Kenneth M Maclin appeared in court, in custody. Attorney Peter Anderson in court for Kenneth Maclin.
Attorney Brookellen Teuber in court for State of Wisconsin.

--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited

Defendant's may appear remotely IF in custody.

cases #22CF108 and #22CF109 called at 8:32am 
Co-Defendant Ronda M Granja in court, in custody with Attorney Richard Burris. 
Co-Defendant Kenneth M Maclin appears by videoconference from Dodge Correctional Institution, in custody. His counsel, Attorney Peter Anderson, appears in court.  
DA Monica Hall appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.  
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.  

As to Case #22CF109-Machlin:
--the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient
--Mr. Machlin waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

As to Case #22CF108-Granja:
--Det. E. Weiss- sworn and testifies
--direct examination by DA Hall 
--cross examination by Attorney Burris
--Arguments given by counsel
--The Court finds probable cause that Ms. Granja committed a felony. The Court binds her over for Trial.
recess 8:51am

[MK] cases #22CF108 and #22CF109 called at 8:45am 
Co-Defendant Ronda M Granja does not appear. Attorney Richard Burris appears.
Co-Defendant Kenneth M. Maclin does not appear. Attorney Peter Anderson appears.
ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance.
These cases are scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today, however the Court has learned that Ms. Granja was taken into custody in Dane County yesterday, and that Mr. Maclin was transferred earlier this week to Dodge Correctional Institution.  
Attorney Burris requests that Ms. Granja be transported here to appear in person at the next hearing. 
Attorney Anderson indicates that he has discussed the topic of appearances-format with Mr. Maclin, and he is asking to appear remotely and not be transported for hearings. 
recess 8:51am 

NEXT:  (1) clerk- in case #22CF108 add the Dane Co. [MK] case called at 8:54am 
Defendant Kenneth M Maclin appears by video/audio conferencing from the Dodge County Jail, in custody. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today. 
The Court notes that Mr. Maclin qualifies for Public Defender representation, however they have not been able to appoint counsel for him to date.  The Court directs the PD to continue those efforts. 
During scheduling discussions, Mr. Maclin indicates that he will still be in the Dodge County Jail on the dates of the next hearings.
